name: Homer
tag_list: education, early-learning, education-reform, childrens-books, learn-to-read, educational-app, apps, kids, ipad, educational, mobile
overview:
Homer is a handcrafted early learning experience for children ages 3 to 9, available this spring in a beautiful, cutting-edge iPad app. Founded in 2012 by Stephanie Dua, a senior advisor to the Common Core standards, Homer is a curated library of more than 600 resources for parents and children.

With a nod to the world’s first-known poet, we’ve created our own Homer, the poet-pigeon, who joins a merry band of other animal characters, guiding children through classic literature and rich science that teaches them to read, think and stretch their imaginations.

Homer’s free app offers a snapshot of the four connected learning experiences that are fully available through a monthly subscription: *Learn to Read teaches children to read in more than 150 step-by-step phonics lessons. *Read A Story builds vocabulary and knowledge through original and classic stories and poems *Discover the World makes connections across subjects and teaches about the natural world. *Create and Share allows children to draw and record ideas and dreams and parents to share them through a personal pin board.

In a world cluttered with games masquerading as education, Homer is a safe space for children to learn, crafted by makers, artists, scientists, parents, and teachers.

Coming to the App Store Spring 2013.
